intro: Acnistus quitensis, commonly known as the Andean moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a distinctive, fleshy capsule that splits open to release seeds. Acnistus quitensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
